emails.subject: [DNLI-001] Site 101 - Participant 101-005 - OLE Rollover Query
emails.body:
Hi David,

Hope you are well.

We have a query regarding participant 101-005. The participant is approaching their Week 25 visit and has expressed strong interest in continuing into the Open-Label Extension (Part C) of the study.

To ensure we can properly consent them, could you please provide clarification on the visit schedule and any specific procedures required for the OLE portion of the trial? We want to make sure we have all the correct information to discuss with the participant.

Please let us know.

Best regards,

Sarah Chen
Clinical Research Coordinator
UCSF Medical Center

emails.subject: Fwd: [DNLI-001] Site 101 - Participant 101-005 - OLE Rollover Query
emails.body:
Hi Alex,

Please see the query below from Site 101 regarding the OLE rollover for participant 101-005.

Could you please provide the site with the requested clarification on the visit schedule and procedures for Part C?

Thanks,
David

--- Forwarded message ---

Subject: [DNLI-001] Site 101 - Participant 101-005 - OLE Rollover Query
To: David Miller <david.miller@syneos.com>
Cc: Michael Lee <mlee@ucsfmed.org>

Hi David,

Hope you are well.

We have a query regarding participant 101-005. The participant is approaching their Week 25 visit and has expressed strong interest in continuing into the Open-Label Extension (Part C) of the study.

To ensure we can properly consent them, could you please provide clarification on the visit schedule and any specific procedures required for the OLE portion of the trial? We want to make sure we have all the correct information to discuss with the participant.

Please let us know.

Best regards,

Sarah Chen
Clinical Research Coordinator
UCSF Medical Center

description: A back-and-forth conversation with a site regarding a participant in Part B who is nearing the end of the 25-week treatment period and has questions about rolling over into the Open-Label Extension (Part C). The site is asking for clarification on the visit schedule and procedures in the OLE to properly consent the participant.
